meanings.definition: Summon or cite (someone) to appear in court.
meanings.sent1: The judge will accite the witness to testify in the trial.
meanings.sent2: Lawyers often accite evidence to support their arguments.
meanings.sent3: The cat accited the mouse to play a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes accited him to confess his feelings.
meanings.sent5: The teacher accited the students to participate in the class discussion.

meanings.definition: Cite as an authority or resource.
meanings.sent1: You can accite the book as a reference in your research paper.
meanings.sent2: Scientists accite previous studies to build upon existing knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The chef accited the recipe to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: Her speech accited historical events to make a compelling argument.
meanings.sent5: The article accited expert opinions to support its claims.
